intro: Xiphocoma leptalea, commonly known as the slender sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Xiphocoma leptalea is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in full sun conditions.
